name: Roman Catholic Church (Latin Rite)
startYear: 1st c. (institutional continuity); distinct identity solidifies over centuries
notes: Under Bishop of Rome (pope); Latin theological tradition; recognizes 21 ecumenical councils (Catholic list).
epistemicPosture: Scripture + Tradition + Magisterium; development of doctrine under papal authority.

name: Eastern Orthodox Church (Byzantine tradition)
primaryRegions: Eastern Europe, Middle East, diaspora; global
startYear: 1st c.; separated from Rome in stages; 1054 watershed
notes: Conciliar/ecclesial structure with autocephalous churches; generally recognizes seven ecumenical councils.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Coptic Orthodox Church (Alexandrian tradition)
notes: Miaphysite Christology; seven sacraments; strong monastic heritage.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Armenian Apostolic Church
notes: Oriental Orthodox Christology; distinct Armenian liturgy.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church
notes: Tewahedo ('unity') tradition; large biblical canon; strong monastic and liturgical life.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Eritrean Orthodox Tewahedo Church
notes: Oriental Orthodox communion; related to Ethiopian tradition.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Syriac Orthodox Church (West Syriac)
notes: West Syriac liturgy; non-Chalcedonian.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church (India)
notes: Part of St Thomas Christian heritage; West Syriac liturgy; Oriental Orthodox communion.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Assyrian Church of the East (East Syriac)
notes: East Syriac rite; historically spread into Persia, Central Asia, India, China; recognizes unique set of sacraments (includes Holy Leaven, sign of Cross).
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Chaldean Catholic Church (East Syriac, Catholic)
notes: East Syriac rite in communion with Rome; related to Church of the East heritage.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Maronite Church (West Syriac, Catholic)
notes: West Syriac/Antiochene tradition; in communion with Rome.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Anglican Communion
primaryRegions: UK and global (Africa, Americas, Asia, Oceania)
notes: Historically via Church of England; wide spectrum (evangelical to Anglo-Catholic).
epistemicPosture: Scripture, tradition, reason; via media between Catholic and Protestant.

name: Lutheran (confessional)
notes: Centered on justification by faith; sacraments as means of grace; Book of Concord.
epistemicPosture: Scripture + confessions; justification by grace through faith and the means of grace.

name: Reformed / Presbyterian
notes: Covenant theology; confessional tradition (Westminster, Heidelberg, Belgic, Dort).
epistemicPosture: Scripture alone; covenant theology and divine sovereignty in salvation.

name: Methodist / Wesleyan
notes: Wesleyan-Arminian theology; emphasis on holiness; retains infant baptism; sacraments as means of grace (varies).
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Baptist (evangelical)
notes: Believer’s baptism; generally ordinances (not sacraments) in evangelical forms; local church polity.
epistemicPosture: Scripture alone; believer's profession and memorial understanding of sacraments.

name: Anabaptist / Mennonite
notes: Believer’s baptism; discipleship/peace emphasis; separation of church/state (varies).
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Pentecostal (Classical; e.g., Assemblies of God)
notes: Emphasis on baptism in the Holy Spirit; continuation of charismatic gifts; often believer’s baptism.
epistemicPosture: Scripture + Spirit; emphasis on gifts, experience, and charismatic renewal.

name: Seventh-day Adventist
notes: Sabbath observance; distinctive eschatology; 28 Fundamental Beliefs.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Restorationist (Stone–Campbell; Churches of Christ / Christian Churches)
notes: Restoration of NT Christianity; baptism often strongly linked with conversion (varies).
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Non-denominational Evangelical (generic)
notes: Very broad; typically sola scriptura, believer’s baptism (often), varying ecclesiology and charismatics.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Jehovah’s Witnesses (Non-Nicene)
notes: Reject Nicene Trinity; included for boundary-marking only.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Latter-day Saints (Mormonism; Non-Nicene)
notes: Non-Nicene; additional scriptures; included for boundary-marking only.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Nubian Christianity (Noubadia/Makuria/Alwa; historical)
notes: Christian kingdoms in Nubia; later Islamization. Doctrinal stance is partly reconstructed from ties to Alexandria and imperial missions; treat as historical case-study.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Syro-Malabar Catholic Church (St Thomas Christians; East Syriac)
notes: Thomas Christian community in communion with Rome; retains East Syriac liturgy; shaped by Portuguese interventions (1599) and later reforms.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Syro-Malankara Catholic Church (West Syriac; reunion stream)
notes: Reunion of a Malankara stream with Rome (20th c.); West Syriac liturgy; Catholic dogmatics with Syriac tradition.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Jacobite Syrian Christian Church (India; West Syriac)
notes: Malankara community aligned with Syriac Orthodox Patriarchate; part of the post-1653 split-line.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Malankara Mar Thoma Syrian Church (Reformed; India)
notes: Reformed movement within Malankara tradition; retains some Syrian liturgical heritage; theologically closer to Anglican/Reformed streams (with local distinctives).
epistemicPosture: Scripture alone; covenant theology and divine sovereignty in salvation.

name: Church of South India (CSI; united church)
notes: Ecumenical union church (Anglican, Methodist, etc.). Positions often resemble Anglican/protestant consensus; local diversity.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Jingjiao / Church of the East in China (historical)
notes: Church of the East presence in Tang China; documented by the Xi'an (Nestorian) Stele; later declines after persecutions.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: African Initiated Churches (AICs; umbrella)
notes: Umbrella for independent African churches (Ethiopianism, Zionist, Aladura, etc.). Doctrine varies; use exemplars below for more specificity.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Zion Christian Church (ZCC; South Africa)
notes: Large Zionist AIC; healing and distinctive practices; doctrinal stance varies by local practice; often broadly Nicene but with strong indigenous expressions.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Aladura Churches (West Africa; prophet-healing)
notes: Prophet-healing churches emphasizing prayer, visions, healing; often trinitarian; practices vary.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Kimbanguist Church (DRC)
notes: Independent church rooted in Simon Kimbangu movement; sources note distinctive prophet/pneumatology claims; treat many positions as qualified unless primary catechisms are consulted.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Georgian Orthodox Church
notes: Autocephalous Orthodox church in Georgia; distinct liturgical/language context (Georgian).
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Melkite Greek Catholic Church (Byzantine Catholic)
notes: Byzantine-rite church in communion with Rome; historically tied to Antioch.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Syriac Catholic Church (West Syriac, Catholic)
notes: West Syriac-rite church in communion with Rome; shares Syriac liturgical heritage.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.

name: Ancient / Old Apostolic Church of the East (East Syriac)
notes: Split from Assyrian Church of the East linked to calendar/fasting disputes; retains East Syriac tradition.
epistemicPosture: Holds to historic Christian orthodoxy within its distinctive tradition.
